title: Winning the Crypto Long Game w/ Haseeb Qureshi & Jordi Alexander | The Big Brain Podcast Ep. 1

Hello and welcome to the Big Brain

Yes. So, I'm a managing partner at

Block, uh, which is on the Unchained

That's Well, I'm I'm here to make sure

So, goal is to sync this podcast. First

you're doing great. So, keep going. I
think I think honestly Jord is doing
more to sync this podcast than I am. So
I would say yeah put it on Jordy, not

I think everyone that has been in the
industry knows that you started as a

us through the journey, you know, of
just going from poker to crypto? I think
there's a lot of similarities between
poker and crypto. Uh, ironically,
there's not a lot of similarities
between venture and poker. Um, and so I
think being on the venture side is
pretty atypical for a lot of the poker
players. Mo, most of the folks I know,
uh, they ended up either on the trading
side, which is very very common, or
ending up a few of them on the builder
side, uh, and end up being
entrepreneurs. VCs, there's very very
few, uh, professional poker players who
end up in in VC. I I think in many ways
the similarities one in order to get
into crypto especially get into crypto
early you had to be somebody who wasn't
afraid of finding small edges that are
somewhat subversive right so it's like
back in the day you know getting into

of thing that your parents wouldn't
really be proud of you for doing you
know your friends would kind of look at
you a little weird and be like hey why

Right now you know Coinbase a public

going back to its roots of being scammy

crypto at this point is like a very

the people who were getting into crypto
at that time they were really kind of

about crypto is that like poker very
male-dominated uh very young and you

they're they're people who are extremely
online. They're staying up late at

of course the fact that you have to be

people who've gotten through crypto have
have had to is selected for that, right?
I know so many people who came into

They just they just left. They just

just, you know, every single year
they're making progress in one

you don't get you don't get to say that.
You don't get to have that. Yeah. Um,
very few people have the constitution to

either they just really [ __ ] believe

What were your lowest moments, right?
Like I think you're you're right in the

Yeah. Thanks for thanks for ruining the

You got to be fashion. You got to be

yeah, extremely fashionable in your in
your t-shirt. Anyway, I was I was
regailing them with the stories of how I

I was on vacation with some friends of

at that time there were no applications.
Yeah. You know like stable coins were
like a billion dollars of stable coins

Nothing was real. It was all just

But that's the last time that I've had

when you have the best opportunities,
there's not that much raising going on.
Did you double down on that fear and

Let's assume that this industry will be

anyway. So, you know, like what what

that was really when we started
investing into, you know, compound and
maker dow and dydx and all this stuff.
That's when we started making those

you know, these were these were tiny,

this thing works with $20 million, like
the math doesn't change when you add two

right? If it works with 20 million, it
works with two billion. it works at 20
20 billion, right? So, it's at this
point just a matter of scaling up, but
if it works at this scale, it's going to

was like, this thing is going to be
real. I don't know how long it's going

no. There's no going back. Uh, both

This is like, do you really think that a

it's tiny right now. I I grant you it's
it's absolutely tiny. But there's only
one way this thing is going to go, and
that's up. So uh co was this huge
accelerant that just completely changed
the conversation around crypto and after
that for me there was no there there was
no real looking back you know I I at
that since then I've had total
confidence that crypto is going to take

But um it's it's a great casino because

this meme like you know if he has a

uh approach crypto and just we're all in

Honestly, similar to I think like my

and and at that time as well I didn't

um you know and since then obviously

and what I like still kind of

with like so many projects in crypto.
So, that that was it for me. So, this is

So why were they spending all their

They they don't do that. That's that's

that this was very intentional and the

every time somebody gets listed on

take this pound of flesh and they give
it to BNB holders and they make sure
that BNB holders make money. They've
been doing this for a [ __ ] decade,
right? Like everybody knows the game.
It's been true always about Binance. FTX
was the opposite. FTX was the one place

you. And retail would get [ __ ] on
every [ __ ] exchange listing on FTX,

just kind of walked around like that was

that's really weird when you look at
exchange. No other exchange was doing

we have like just like you know the
